# Unable to open RT file generated by Slicer

**Topic ID**: 13380
**Date**: 2020-09-07
**URL**: https://discourse.slicer.org/t/unable-to-open-rt-file-generated-by-slicer/13380

---

## Post #1 by @Gabriel_T (2020-09-07 21:54 UTC)

<p>I loaded two nrrd volumes, one has the CT volume , the other has a binary segmentation mask. I am able to load and view them without any problem.<br>
But when I try to save it by exporting to RTseries, it generates the dicom files for each slice and a single RTS dicom file. But when I try to load this directory it tries to load each slice as individual files along with the RTS like in the below screenshot<br>

</div></a></div></p>
<p>When I hit OK it loads all the slices as individual slices (is there any way it can be loaded as a single volume ?) but it gives a big error when it tries to load the rts file<br>
vtkITKArchetypeImageSeriesReader::ExecuteInformation: Cannot open C:/Users/gabri/Desktop/2/rtss_1.2.826.0.1.3680043.8.274.1.1.3528944502.44294.5368913286.4316.dcm. ITK exception info: error in unknown:  Could not create IO object for reading file C:/Users/gabri/Desktop/2/rtss_1.2.826.0.1.3680043.8.274.1.1.3528944502.44294.5368913286.4316.dcm<br>

---

## Post #2 by @lassoan (2020-09-08 01:44 UTC)

<p>Some images may be loaded using “Add data” window, but in generatl you need to open DICOM files using DICOM module.</p>
<p>I would recommend to use the latest Slicer Preview Release, as it has many DICOM support improvements.</p>

---
